{{Infobox person |name = Giannis Vardinogiannis
Γιάννης Βαρδινογιάννης{{cite web|url=http://provocateur.gr/archive/6018/h-zwh-toy-tzigger-makria-apo-ton-panathhna-ko|title=Η ζωή του Τζίγγερ μακριά από τον Παναθηναϊκό|first=|last=Christiano|publisher=|accessdate=1 August 2018}} |image = |image_size = |alt = |caption = |birth_name = Giannis Vardinogiannis |birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1962|4|7}} |birth_place = [[Heraklion]], Greece |nationality = Greek |residence = [[Ekali]], [[Athens]], Greece |alma_mater = [[Vassar College]] |occupation = [[Entrepreneur]] & [[shipowner]]http://www.famcap.com/articles/2015/7/1/greek-family-businesses-five-notable-ones |years_active = 1984– |boards = Vice President of [[Motor Oil Hellas]]http://www.moh.gr/Default.aspx?a_id=10569
President of [[Avin International S.A.]]{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/profiles/people/16544008-john-v-vardinoyannis|title=Ioannis Vardinoyannis, Motor Oil Hellas Corinth Refineries SA: Profile & Biography - Bloomberg|website=Bloomberg|accessdate=1 August 2018}}
CEO of [[Vegas Oil and Gas]] |net_worth = |spouse = Mellissa Gromel |children = 3 |parents = [[Vardis Vardinogiannis]]
[[Marianna Vardinoyannis]] }} '''Giannis Vardinogiannis''' ({{lang-el|Γιάννης Βαρδινογιάννης}}, born 7 April 1962) is a Greek billionaire shipping magnate, the eldest son of petroleum tycoon [[Vardis Vardinogiannis]]. He is included in the [[Lloyd's List]] ''Most influential people in the shipping industry''. ==Early life and career== He majored in economics at [[Vassar College]] in the United States. He is a former [[Rallying|car rally]] champion who owns the private rally team Cyclon Rally Sport, with seven participations (from 1986 to 1992) in the international [[Acropolis Rally]]. He was the first Greek driver in Acropolis Rally for five years from 1988 to 1992. He won six times (1987 to 1992) the Greek Rally title, driving [[Lancia Delta]] with co-driver Kostas Stefanis. Since his retirement from the sport, in 1993, he works in the family business([[Vardinogiannis]] [[group of companies]]),{{cite web|url=http://www.tradewindsnews.com/weekly/153634/vardinoyannis-empire |title=Vardinoyannis EMPIRE | TradeWinds |publisher=Tradewindsnews.com |date= |accessdate=2015-10-24}} which has interests in oil, shipping, television broadcasting, publishing, banking etc. The Vardinogiannis family owns the multi-billion oil refining company [[Motor Oil Hellas]], in whose Board of Directors is Yannis Vardinogiannis, and also serves shipping company [[Avin International S.A.]], and [[Piraeus Bank]]{{cite web|url=http://bankingnews.gr/index.php?id=342434|title=Οι βασικοί μέτοχοι Κωστόπουλος, Λάτσης, Βαρδινογιάννης μηδένισαν στις ελληνικές τράπεζες, αντικαταστάθηκαν από funds|publisher=|accessdate=1 August 2018}}. He is the principal shareholder of the Cairo-based [[Vegas Oil and Gas]]. ==As owner of Panathinaikos F.C.== In the summer of 2000, the President of [[Panathinaikos FC|Panathinaikos]], [[Yiorgos Vardinogiannis]], resigned from his duties and sold his share to his nephew Giannis Vardinogiannis, who changed the style of management into the club. On 22 April 2008, main shareholder Vardinogiannis gave a press conference in which he announced the decision of his family to reduce their share in the club to 50% – after 30 years of full ownership – through a €800 million increase of the company's capital stock. After the negotiations and the share capital increase, the Vardinogiannis family would hold 56% of the club, Panathinaikos Athlitikos Omilos 10% and the rest shareholders 34%. The Vardinogiannis family finally withdrew from Panathinaikos in 2012. The team had the following successes as an owner of Panathinaikos: - Quarter-finals in Champions League: 2001-02 - Quarter-finals in Uefa Cup: 2002-03 - Greek Championship: 2004, 2010 - Greek Cup: 2004, 2010 ==Political views== In February 2015 Vardinogiannis said in a statement to [[Reuters]] that the new Prime Minister of Greece [[Alexis Tsipras]] had a valid point in attacking the corrupted Greek oligarchs.{{cite web|last=Grey |first=Stephen |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/02/17/uk-eurozone-greece-corruption-insight-idUKKBN0LL13K20150217 |title=Insight - PM Tsipras declares war at home on Greece's 'oligarchs' | Reuters |publisher=Uk.reuters.com |date=2015-02-17 |accessdate=2015-10-24}} ==See also== *[[Panathinaikos FC]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.vegasoil.com/}} *{{Official website|http://www.rally.gr/}} *{{Official website|http://www.rallybase.nl/}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vardinogiannis, Giannis}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Greek football chairmen and investors]] [[Category:Greek rally drivers]] [[Category:Vassar College alumni]] [[Category:Greek male sport shooters]] [[Category:Panathinaikos A.O.]] [[Category:Panathinaikos F.C.]] {{Greece-business-bio-stub}}

{{EngvarB|date=February 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{Infobox company | name = Guaranty Trust Bank plc | logo = Guaranty Trust Bank.jpg | logo_size = 240px | type = [[Public limited company]] | traded_as = {{lse|GRTB}} | ISIN = US40124Q2084 | area_served = [[Cote d'Ivoire]], [[Kenya]], [[Liberia]], [[Gambia]], [[Ghana]], [[Nigeria]], [[Rwanda]], [[Tanzania]], [[Uganda]], [[United Kingdom]] | key_people = [[Segun Agbaje]], ([[CEO]]) [[Osaretin Demuren]], ([[Chairman]]) | industry = Finance |products = [[Retail banking]]
[[Commercial bank]]ing
[[Corporate banking]] | services = Banking | revenue = {{increase}} ₦ 278.5 billion (2014) | operating_income = {{increase}} ₦ 210.8 billion (2014) | net_income = {{increase}} ₦ 98.7 billion (2014) | assets = {{increase}} ₦ 3.16Trillion (2016) | equity = {{increase}} ₦ 374.3 billion (2014) | num_employees = 10,000+ (2014) | foundation = 17 January 1990 | location_city = 635 Akin Adesola Street, [[Victoria Island, Lagos]], [[Lagos State]], Nigeria | homepage = {{URL|http://www.gtbank.com/}} }} '''Guaranty Trust Bank plc''' also known as '''GTBank''' or simply '''GTB''' is a Nigerian [[Multinational corporation|multinational]] [[financial institution]], that offers Online/Internet Banking, Retail Banking, Corporate Banking, Investment Banking and Asset Management services, with its head office in [[Victoria Island (Nigeria)|Victoria Island]], [[Lagos]]. The bank was formed in 1988 by over 35 young Nigerians in their thirties, spearheaded mostly by [[Tayo Aderinokun]] and [[Fola Adeola]], but also included [[Femi Pedro]], [[Gbolahan Osibodu]], [[Femi Akingbe]], [[Akin Opeodu]] and others. {{Cite news|url=http://www.jarushub.com/they-dared-they-did-the-story-of-youngsters-that-founded-gtb/|title=THEY DARED, THEY DID: THE STORY OF YOUNGSTERS THAT FOUNDED GTB|date=2016-10-10|work=JarusHub - Nigeria's No. 1 Career Website|access-date=2018-01-18|language=en-US}} == History == Guaranty Trust Bank plc was incorporated as a limited liability company licensed to provide commercial and other banking services to the Nigerian public in 1990 and commenced operations in February 1991. In September 1996, Guaranty Trust Bank plc became a publicly quoted company and won the Nigerian Stock Exchange President’s Merit award. In February 2002, the Bank was granted a universal banking license and later appointed a settlement bank by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) in 2003.{{Cite web|url=http://www.gtbank.com/about-gtbank/our-company/history|title=History - Guaranty Trust Bank Plc|last=User|first=Super|website=www.gtbank.com|access-date=2017-08-17}} Guaranty Trust Bank undertook its second share offering in 2004 and raised over N11 billion from Nigerian Investors to expand its operations. On 26 July 2007 GTBank became the very first [[Sub-Saharan Africa|subsaharan]] bank and first Nigerian [[joint stock company]] to be listed on [[London Stock Exchange]] and [[Deutsche Börse]]. The IPO raised US$750,000,000.forbes.com: [https://www.forbes.com/markets/feeds/afx/2007/07/10/afx3897102.html „''Nigeria's Guaranty Trust Bank to raise 750 mln usd from London listing“''] (11 September 2007) In the same year, they successfully placed Nigeria's first private Eurobond issue on the international capital markets.clickafrique.com: [http://www.clickafrique.com/Magazine/ST010/CP0000002294.aspx ''GTBank completes Nigeria's first private EuroBond Issue.''] The GTBank USD 500,000,000 Eurobond was the first ever Benchmark Eurobond issue by a Nigerian corporate and the second Eurobond programme by GTBank in the last 5 years.thisdaylive.com: [http://www.thisdaylive.com/articles/gtbank-s-us-500-million-eurobond-oversubscribed/91872/ ''GTBank’s US$500 million Eurobond Oversubscribed''] The long-term debts of Guaranty Trust Bank plc are rated [[Standard & Poor's#Long-term credit ratings|BB-]] by [[Standard & Poor's]] and AA- by [[Fitch Ratings]], which are the highest ratings for a Nigerian bank.{{Cite news|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201201060827.html|title=Nigeria: S&P Rates Firstbank, Zenith, GTB Positive|last=Ahmed|first=Idris|date=2012-01-06|work=Daily Trust (Abuja)|access-date=2017-08-17}}{{Cite news|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/200904160052.html|title=Nigeria: GTBank Gets AA Minus By Fitch|last=Egwuatu|first=Peter|date=2009-04-16|work=Vanguard (Lagos)|access-date=2017-08-17}} They introduced [[online banking]] and [[SMS banking]] in Nigeria and a [[naira]] denominated [[MasterCard]] as well as the ''Platinum'' and ''World Signia'' cards and with ''GTB-on-wheels'', mobile branches. On 12 March 2008, GTBank was given a banking licence for the [[United Kingdom]] by the [[Financial Services Authority]].allafrica.com: [http://allafrica.com/stories/200803120199.html „''GTBank to Commence Operations in UK“''] GTBank is a partner of [[Eko Atlantic City]] a new made island (820 ha.) in the [[Atlantic]] ocean, adjacent to Victoria Island Lagos. It will be the home of the new Financial District. The building of Eko Atlantic City started in 2009 and is expected to be finished in 2016.[http://www.ekoatlantic.com/about/aboutus_partners.htm ekoatlantic.com] To commemorate the bank's 20th anniversary, the [[Nigerian Postal Service]] issued a set of GTBank Anniversary postage stamps. This was the first time in Nigeria that a corporate organization was honored in such a way.nigeriacommunicationsweek.com.ng: [http://www.nigeriacommunicationsweek.com.ng/node/2973 ''NIPOST Launches Stamps to Mark GTBank 20th Anniversary''] In 2011, the bank became the biggest bank in Nigeria by market capitalisation.thisdaylive.com: [http://www.thisdaylive.com/articles/gtbank-leads-banking-stocks-in-market-capitalisation/106397/ ''GTBank Leads Banking Stocks in Market Capitalisation''] In 2013, the bank acquired 70 percent shareholding in the [[Fina Bank Group]] for a cash payment of US$100 million.{{cite web|accessdate=7 June 2015|first=.| url=http://mobile.nation.co.ke/business/Regulator-approves-plan-by-Nigerian-bank-to-buy-70pc-Fina-stake/-/1950106/2128696/-/format/xhtml/-/10q16i3/-/index.html| title=Regulator Approves Plan By Nigerian Bank To Buy 70 Percent Fina Stake|date=29 December 2013|last=Nation Correspondent|newspaper=[[Daily Nation|Daily Nation Mobile]] (Nairobi)}} Fina Bank branches and subsidiaries were rebranded GT Bank soon afterwards. In 2013, the Bank issued a USD 400,000,000 Euro bond at a coupon rate of 6%; the least obtained by a Nigerian company in the international capital market. The Eurobond was issued under the USD 2,000,000 Global Medium Term Note Programme, which is registered under both Regulation in the United State of America and Rule 144A in the United Kingdom and sold to investors across Africa, America, Asia and Europe.{{Cite web|url=http://www.gtbank.com/about-gtbank/our-company/history|title=History - Guaranty Trust Bank Plc|last=User|first=Super|website=www.gtbank.com|access-date=2017-08-17}} The Bank has over 10,000 employees.{{Cite web|url=http://www.gtbank.com/about-gtbank|title=About GTBank - Guaranty Trust Bank Plc|last=User|first=Super|website=www.gtbank.com|access-date=2017-08-17}} ==Leadership == *[[Osaretin Demuren]] is Chairman; [[Segun Agbaje]] is Managing Director/CEO. The other board of directors are Adebayo Adeola, Olabode Augusto, Ibrahim Hassan, Hezekiah Oyinlola, Imoni Akpofure, Olutola Omotola, Demola Odeyemi, Miriam Olusanya, Haruna Musa and Bolaji Lawal.{{cite web|url=http://www.gtbank.com/about-gtbank/our-people/the-board|website=GTBank Plc|accessdate=9 July 2015|title=The Board - Guaranty Trust Bank Plc}} == Branches and Subsidiaries == GTBank plc has 231 branches, 17 Cash Centres, 18 e-branches, 41 GTExpress locations and more than 1165 [[Automated teller machine|ATMs]] in Nigeria. GTBank has expanded to Cote d'Ivoire, Gambia, Ghana, Liberia, Sierra Leone, Uganda, Kenya and Rwanda. These countries belong to the "[[West African Monetary Zone|Eco zone]]". It has also expanded to the United Kingdom. With the acquisition of a 70 per cent stake in [[Fina Bank Group|Fina Bank]] GTBank expanded into the [[East Africa]]n market as at December 2013. As a consequence, Fina Bank will now be renamed and rebranded as subsidiaries of GTBank.allafrica.com: [http://allafrica.com/stories/201312270231.html''Nigeria: GTBank Concludes Acquisition of Fina Bank, Kenya''] GTBank has subsidiaries in the following countries: # [[Guaranty Trust Bank (Kenya)|GTBank Kenya]] - [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]] {{flagicon|Kenya}} # [[Guaranty Trust Bank (Rwanda)|GTBank Rwanda]] - [[Kigali]], [[Rwanda]] {{flagicon|Rwanda}} # [[Guaranty Trust Bank (Uganda)|GTBank Uganda]] - [[Kampala]], [[Uganda]] {{flagicon|Uganda}} # GTBank Côte d'Ivoire - [[Abidjan]], [[Ivory Coast]] {{flagicon|Ivory Coast}} # GTBank Gambia - [[Banjul]], [[Gambia]] {{flagicon|Gambia}} # GTBank Ghana - [[Accra]], [[Ghana]] {{flagicon|Ghana}} # GTBank Liberia - [[Monrovia]], [[Liberia]] {{flagicon|Liberia}} # GTBank Sierra Leone - [[Freetown]], [[Sierra Leone]] {{flagicon|Sierra Leone}} # GTBank UK - [[London]], [[England]], [[United Kingdom]] {{flagicon|United Kingdom}} # GTBank Tanzania - [[Dar es Salaam]], [[Tanzania]] {{flagicon|Tanzania}} ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == *{{Official website|www.gtbank.com}} *[http://www.broadstreetlagos.com/company-detail/guaranty-trust-bank-PLC-profile-GTB/cpr BSL-Finance Guaranty Trust Bank Profile] *[http://www.broadstreetlagos.com/company-detail/guaranty-trust-bank-PLC-summary-GTB/qs BSL-Finance Guaranty Trust Bank Summary] [[Category:Companies listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange]] [[Category:Companies listed on the London Stock Exchange]] [[Category:Companies based in Lagos]] [[Category:Banks of Nigeria]] [[Category:Banks of Ivory Coast]] [[Category:Banks of the Gambia]] [[Category:Banks of Ghana]] [[Category:Banks of Liberia]] [[Category:Banks of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Companies of Nigeria]] [[Category:Banks established in 1990]] [[Category:Victoria Island, Lagos]] [[Category:Banks]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Henry Bonilla |image = Bonilla picture.JPG |state = Texas |district = {{ushr|TX|23|23rd}} |term_start = January 3, 1993 |term_end = January 3, 2007 |predecessor = [[Albert Bustamante]] |successor = [[Ciro Rodriguez]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1954|1|2}} |birth_place = [[San Antonio]], [[Texas]], [[United States|U.S.]] |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |spouse = Deborah Knapp (Divorced)
Sheryl White Shelby |children = 2 |education = [[University of Texas at Austin|University of Texas, Austin]] ([[Bachelor of Journalism|BJourn]]) }} '''Henry Bonilla''' (born January 2, 1954) is a former congressman who represented [[Texas's 23rd congressional district]] in the [[United States House of Representatives]]. He was defeated in his bid for re-election by [[Ciro Rodriguez|Ciro Davis Rodriguez]], a former [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] member of Congress, in a [[special election]] runoff held on December 12, 2006. His term expired January 3, 2007 when the 110th Congress officially began. ==Roots in San Antonio== Bonilla was born in [[San Antonio, Texas|San Antonio]], the son of Anita Arellano and Enrique A. Bonilla.[http://freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.com/~battle/reps/bonilla.htm 1 "Henry Bonilla,"] ''Rootsweb.com''. When he was young he joined a TRIO [[Educational Talent Search]] program, which provides academic support and college awareness activities to students. He graduated from South San Antonio High School in 1972 and received his Bachelor of Journalism degree from the [[University of Texas at Austin]] in 1976. Before entering politics, he was a television news executive at San Antonio's [[CBS]] affiliate, [[KENS-TV]]. His former wife, Deborah Knapp (born December 1, 1954), continues as an anchor at the station. He has since married the former Sheryl White Shelby (born 1959). ==Congressional career== In March 1992, Bonilla won the 23rd district's [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] nomination for a seat in the U.S. House of Representatives ([https://web.archive.org/web/20050909082641/http://nationalatlas.gov/printable/images/preview/congdist/tx23_109.gif map]). The 23rd had been a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] district since its creation in 1967, but Bonilla charged four-term incumbent [[Albert G. Bustamante]] with neglecting his constituents' needs, being involved in the [[House banking scandal]] by writing 30 "cheques calientes" in the House Bank, and taking excessive and questionable junkets abroad. Bonilla got an inadvertent assist from the state legislature, which left a heavily Republican area of western San Antonio in the 23rd while carving the new 28th District out of much of the 23rd's territory. Despite being outspent by $758,453 to $594,032 and being in a district that [[Bill Clinton]] carried the same year, Bonilla won by a huge 21-point margin, 59 to 38 percent, the largest margin of defeat for an incumbent that year. In March 1999, Governor [[George W. Bush]] named Bonilla as the only Texan on his presidential [[exploratory committee]]. Bonilla often represented Bush on national news programs and as a surrogate speaker. Although the 23rd had a slight Democratic lean, Bonilla developed a very conservative voting record. Largely because of his popularity in San Antonio, he did not face a credible challenge until 2002, when Democrat [[Henry Cuellar]], a former Texas secretary of state, came within two points of unseating him. Bonilla announced that he would probably run in 2006 for the [[United States Senate]] seat held by fellow Republican [[Kay Bailey Hutchison]] if she ran for [[governor of Texas|governor]] in 2006 against the [[incumbent]] Republican [[Rick Perry]]. However, Hutchison decided to run for another term in the Senate. ==American Dream PAC== When Bonilla took charge in 1999 of an independent political fund called American Dream PAC, he made clear that its mission was to "give significant, direct financial assistance to first-rate minority GOP candidates". However, between 1999 and the end of 2003, only $48,750 (or 8.9 percent) of the $547,000 the PAC has received, has gone to minority office-seekers, while more than $100,000 has been routed to Republican Party organizations or causes.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} Bonilla defends his PAC's record of assisting minority candidates, saying, "We did the best we could." In all, 27 minority office-seekers, predominantly Hispanic-American, received money, mostly small donations. But Bonilla said it was sometimes difficult to find "good, solid minority candidates to expend the funds on". In July 2003, the treasurer of the PAC pleaded guilty to embezzling $119,021 between 1999 and 2003 and was sentenced to 15 months in prison. The thefts were not discovered until almost four years after they began. "It was a black mark on my judgment", Bonilla said in a 2004 interview.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} ==2003 redistricting== Bonilla was priming for a rematch against Cuellar in 2004, but in 2003, a controversial [[2003 Texas redistricting|mid-decade redistricting]] by the Texas legislature, the results of efforts by U.S. House Majority Leader [[Tom DeLay]], moved most of Laredo, which had been one of the cores of the 23rd since its formation, to the 28th district. In its place, Bonilla received several heavily Republican San Antonio suburbs that had previously been in the nearby 21st District, all but assuring him of a seventh term. Meanwhile, Cuellar entered and won the 2004 primary against the 28th's incumbent Democrat [[Ciro Rodriguez]] and then went on to win the general election. Bonilla contributed money from his American Dream PAC to the redistricting effort. Soon after the 2004 election, Bonilla was criticized when he proposed a procedural rule change that would permit House leaders to retain their leadership positions despite having been indicted by a state grand jury.{{cite web|url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/opinion/editorials/stories/MYSA120306.2H.Bonilla2ed.221ba8a.html|author=Charles Babington|title=GOP Pushes Rule Change to Protect DeLay's Post|publisher=Washington Post|accessdate=July 11, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080625041055/http://www.mysanantonio.com/opinion/editorials/stories/MYSA120306.2H.Bonilla2ed.221ba8a.html|archive-date=June 25, 2008|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} The proposal would have allowed Tom DeLay to remain as Majority Leader despite having been indicted by the Travis County district attorney's office for possible campaign finance violations. Many constituents believed that Bonilla was blatantly repaying a political favor to DeLay for having favorably redrawn the 23rd District.{{cite web|url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/opinion/editorials/stories/MYSA120306.2H.Bonilla2ed.221ba8a.html|author=Staff|title=With seniority, Bonilla the better runoff option|date=December 2, 2006|publisher=My San Antonio Opinion|accessdate=July 11, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080625041055/http://www.mysanantonio.com/opinion/editorials/stories/MYSA120306.2H.Bonilla2ed.221ba8a.html|archive-date=June 25, 2008|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} On June 29, 2006, the [[U.S. Supreme Court]], with Justice [[Anthony Kennedy]] taking the lead, ruled in ''[[League of United Latin American Citizens v. Perry]]'' that Bonilla's district violated the Civil Rights Act, although the justices upheld most of the 2003 redistricting. The Court declared that the Texas legislature violated the rights of Latino voters when it cut most of Laredo out of the 23rd. Although the reconfigured 23rd was still 55 percent Latino, only 46 percent of the district's voting-age population was Latino.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} The justices held that as a result, the new district didn't have enough Latinos to pass muster under the [[Voting Rights Act]]. Since the legislature hadn't created an acceptable majority-Latino district (its intended replacement, the [[Austin, Texas|Austin]]-to-[[McAllen, Texas|McAllen]] [[Texas's 25th congressional district|25th]], was not considered compact enough), the reconfigured 23rd had to be struck down as well. Because of the size of the 23rd, the ruling effectively forced the redrawing of nearly every district from El Paso to San Antonio. Precedent dictated that a new map had to be issued before the November elections.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} The court issued the new lines on August 7. It moved all of Laredo out of the 23rd and into the 28th, but nevertheless made the district much friendlier to Democrats by boosting its Latino population to 65 percent. In particular, Bonilla lost many of the strongly Republican areas he had inherited in the 2003 redistricting. At the same time, he picked up much of heavily Democratic south San Antonio.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} Bonilla had grown up in this area, which had been part of the 23rd from 1967-93. The court ordered an all-party primary on Election Day, with a December runoff if no candidate wins 50 percent of the vote. The new map included Rodriguez' home and much of his former base, and he announced that he would run against Bonilla in November. [[Federal Elections Commission]] records show Bonilla paid the [[Los Angeles]]-based law firm of [[Latham & Watkins]] $100,000 in 2006, from his campaign funds, to argue that the district boundaries were constitutional. In February, the firm filed an ''amicus'' brief before the Supreme Court in support of the redistricting plan.{{cite web|url=http://www.tpmmuckraker.com/archives/001156.php|author=Justin Rood|title=Lawmaker Blew Big Bucks to Keep District Lines Unfair – to His Own Voters.|publisher=[[Talking Points Memo|TPM Muckraker]]|accessdate=July 11, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929091428/http://www.tpmmuckraker.com/archives/001156.php|archive-date=September 29, 2007|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} ==Defeat in 2006== On November 7, Bonilla faced six Democrats, including [[Ciro Rodriguez]] and [[Vietnam War]] veteran [[Rick Bolanos]] in the all-candidate special election required by the court decision on redistricting (see above). The ballot also included one independent. Bolanos had won the Democratic primary earlier in the year. In the first special election, Bonilla won 48 percent of the vote to Rodriguez's 20 percent. Since no one gained a majority, there was a runoff between the two former colleagues.[http://www.kansascity.com/mld/kansascity/news/politics/elections/16224956.htm] dead link. According to unofficial results of the Texas Secretary of State [http://204.65.107.84/06decspcrun.htm?x=0&y=0&id=824]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, Rodriguez won the runoff with 54% of the vote to Bonilla's 46%. Bonilla was the first Republican incumbent in Texas to be unseated by a Democrat in 10 years, since [[Nick Lampson]]'s defeat of [[Steve Stockman]] in a 1996 runoff election. Lampson was also returned to Congress in 2006 after being defeated for reelection in 2004, like Rodriguez in another district. Bonilla said in interviews the night of his defeat that his loss was in part a result of the changed districting. He ran controversial commercials that claimed that Rodriguez took funds from [[terrorist]]s, which media outlets called "bold claims". He later apologized to the press for any of those who took offense, but stood by his statement.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}} [[Image:Bonilla Healthcare Facility, Laredo, TX IMG 2271.JPG|right|thumb|200px|The Henry Bonilla Healthcare Facility off [[Texas State Highway 359]] South in [[Laredo, Texas]]]] However, a large number of Hispanics and Latinos, who predominantly reside in District 23, had expressed disdain for Bonilla by stating that he had fallen out of touch with the needs and concerns of minorities. His reputation even earned him the nickname "Henry Vanilla", as some Hispanics claimed that Bonilla no longer could relate to his culture. In a year of war, illegal immigration issues, and a proposed border fence, Latinos left the Republicans side in droves.{{cite web|url=http://www.beyondchron.org/news/index.php?itemid=4016|author=Paul Hogarth|title=Latino Voters Bring Victory to Texas Democrats|publisher=Beyond Chron.org|accessdate=July 11, 2009}} ==Failed nomination as ambassador== After his term in Congress expired, Bonilla was nominated to be Permanent Representative of the United States of America to the [[Organization of American States]], with the rank of [[Ambassador]].{{cite web|url=https://georgewbush-whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2007/03/20070315-5.html|author=Office of the Press Secretary|title=Personnel Announcement|publisher=The White House|accessdate=July 11, 2009}} After two months with no action by the Senate, Bonilla asked U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] to withdraw his nomination.{{cite web|url=https://www.senate.gov/pagelayout/legislative/one_item_and_teasers/nom_wdr.htm |author=United States Senate |title=Nominations Withdrawn |publisher=Senate.gov|accessdate=July 11, 2009}} Following the withdrawal of his ambassador nomination, Bonilla joined the Washington-based firm [http://www.thenormandygrp.com/ The Normandy Group]. ==Consideration for Trump Cabinet== In December 2016, Bonilla and two other Texas Republicans, [[Texas Agriculture Commissioner]] [[Sid Miller (politician)|Sid Miller]] and Miller's predecessor in that office, [[Susan Combs]], were interviewed for the position of [[United States Secretary of Agriculture]].''[[San Antonio Express-News]]'', December 31, 2016, pg. 1. ==See also== *[[List of Hispanic and Latino Americans in the United States Congress]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.henrybonilla.com/ Bonilla's campaign site] {{CongLinks|congbio=b000617}} * {{C-SPAN|henrybonilla}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20081005151900/http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2006/06/29/ap/politics/mainD8IHPP180.shtml Redistrict Ruling May Affect Nov. Election, Associated Press] * [http://www.beyondchron.org/news/index.php?itemid=4016 Latino Voters Bring Victory to Texas Democrats] {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-hs}} {{s-bef|before=[[Albert Bustamante]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Member of the [[List of United States Representatives from Texas|U.S. House of Representatives]]
from [[Texas's 23rd congressional district]]|years=1993–2007}} {{s-aft|after=[[Ciro Rodriguez]]}} {{s-end}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bonilla, Henry}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:21st-century American politicians]] [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:American male journalists]] [[Category:American politicians of Mexican descent]] [[Category:American television journalists]] [[Category:Baptists from Texas]] [[Category:Hispanic and Latino American members of the United States Congress]] [[Category:Journalists from Texas]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from Texas]] [[Category:People from San Antonio]] [[Category:Republican Party members of the United States House of Representatives]] [[Category:Texas Republicans]] [[Category:20th-century American politicians]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2017}} {{EngvarB|date=February 2017}} [[File:Hugh Hendry.jpg|thumb]]'''Hugh Hendry''' (born March 1969) is the founding partner and, at various times, the chief investment officer, chief executive officer and chief portfolio manager of Eclectica Asset Management. He began to attract attention when his fund achieved a 31.2 per cent positive return in 2008 in the depths of the [[Global Financial Crisis|financial crisis]], earning him a reputation as a [[Contrarian investing|contrarian]] investor,<ref name="Hugh Hendry Bio">[http://valueslots.com/other-investors/hugh-hendry/hugh-hendry-bio/ "Hugh Hendry Bio"], Valueslots. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> but his claim on wider public notice was based in a series of outspoken media appearances. Hendry has been referred to as "the most high-profile Scot" in the [[hedge fund]] sector.<ref name="Herald">Sharp, Tim. [http://www.heraldscotland.com/business/markets-economy/scottish-hedge-fund-king-i-m-heading-offshore-to-avoid-brussels-penalties-1.993348 "Scottish hedge fund king: I’m heading offshore to avoid Brussels"], [[The Herald (Glasgow)|The Herald]], 20 December 2009. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref>
Hendry once said to an interviewer: "To my mind, the three most important principles when it comes to investing are Albert Camus's principles of ethics: God is dead, life is absurd and there are no rules." He suggested that a great fund manager was defined by "an ability to establish a contentious premise outside the existing belief system, and have it go on and be adopted by the rest of the financial community".<ref>Norton, Leslie P. [http://online.barrons.com/article/SB50001424052748703786004577221590093305080.html?mod=BOL_twm_fs#printMode "Barron's Interview: Keeping an Eye on Wealth Creation"], [[Barron's (newspaper)|Barron's]], 20 December 2009. Retrieved 19 July 2012.</ref>
==Background and career==
Hendry was born in [[Glasgow]], Scotland, in 1969 and graduated from [[Strathclyde University]] in 1990 with a BA in economics and finance. His father worked as a lorry driver and he was the first member of his family to go to university.<ref name="An Outspoken Man in a Secretive Trade">Werdigier, Julia. [https://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/20/business/global/20hedge.html?_r=1&ref=business "An Outspoken Man in a Secretive Trade"], [[The New York Times]], 19 July 2010. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref>
In 1991 Hendry joined the prestigious [[Edinburgh]] investment management firm, [[Baillie Gifford]]. He claimed that he was hired only because investors had instructed the company to recruit more working-class employees.<ref name="Herald"/>
After Baillie Gifford he worked for [[Credit Suisse|Credit Suisse Asset Management]]. Following a chance meeting with [[Crispin Odey]], Hendry joined Odey Asset Management in 1999. "It was a meeting of minds," Hendry said. "He checked my references, got the message that I was a troublemaker, and said, 'You're one of us, you're one of the pirates'."<ref name="Master of the universe">Usborne, Simon. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/analysis-and-features/master-of-the-universe-can-hugh-hendry-teach-us-to-love-hedge-funds-1924913.html "Master of the universe: Can Hugh Hendry teach us to love hedge funds?"], [[The Independent]], 28 May 2010. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref>
He learned the art of "momentum investing"<ref name="Hugh Hendry Bio"/><ref name="Focus in the Eye of the Storm">Fieldhouse, Stuart.[http://www.thehedgefundjournal.com/magazine/200805/profiles/choppy-waters-are-meat-and-drink-for-eclecticas-hugh-hendry.php "Focus In the Eye of the Storm: Choppy waters are meat and drink for Eclectica's Hugh Hendry"], [[The Hedge Fund Journal]], May 2008. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> and was responsible for managing a range of funds from the Eclectica Fund to more than a $1 billion of long only European mandates, including the award-winning Odey Continental European Fund.<ref>[http://www.eclectica-am.com/template.aspx?target=people "Eclectica Asset Management: People"]{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, Eclectica Asset Management website. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> "(Odey) taught me how to manage money," Hendry said. "More than that, he taught me how to misbehave. Misbehaviour is all about curiosity, how you invoke and think about change, which is very necessary in the management of money."<ref name="The MT Interview">Blackhurst, Chris. [http://www.managementtoday.co.uk/features/1061079/MT-Interview-Crispin-Odey-Odey-Asset-Management/ "The MT Interview: Crispin Odey of Odey Asset Management"], [[Management Today]], 1 April 2011. Retrieved 13 June 2012.</ref>
===Eclectica Asset Management===
Eclectica Asset Management was founded in 2005<ref>[http://www.eclectica-am.com/template.aspx?target=home "Eclectica Asset Management: Home"]{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, Eclectica Asset Management website. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> when Hendry and his colleague Simon Batten purchased the management contract of the Eclectica Fund from Odey to establish themselves as a stand-alone fund manager.<ref name="Master of the universe"/> "A lot of people define investors as value or growth. We are neither. We are time investors," Hendry said.<ref name="Focus in the Eye of the Storm"/>
Despite his reputation as a [[Contrarian investing|contrarian]], Hendry explained to the [[Financial Times]] in July 2012 that his approach continued to be based in taking advantage of market momentum. "Our ideas are harshly disciplined by market trends. You will never see us pursue a homegrown idea when it is to the detriment of the prevailing trend," he said.<ref>Cookson, Robert. [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/06dac24c-cca6-11e1-9c96-00144feabdc0.html#axzz20zbhsi8c "Hendry – ‘Bad things are going to happen’"], [[Financial Times]], 17 July 2012. Retrieved 19 July 2012.</ref>
He closed the fund in 2017 due to consistently poor annual performances since 2009.
==Media appearances== Hendry has become known in the United Kingdom for his outspoken commentary on the [[Global Financial Crisis|financial crisis]]. On an episode of the [[BBC]]'s [[Newsnight]] programme aired on 9 April 2010, Hendry began his response to comments by the Nobel Prize–winning economist [[Joseph Stiglitz]] on the financial position of Greece by saying, "Erm, hello. Can I tell you about the real world?"<ref name="An Outspoken Man in a Secretive Trade"/><ref name="Stiglitz">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E4MAifsp-8E "Euro currency crumbling?, discussion on BBC Newsnight"], [[Newsnight]], 9 April 2010. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> On the same programme in May 2010, Hendry responded to a question from host [[Jeremy Paxman]] about the current European economic situation and the possibility of a Greek sovereign debt default with the comment, "I would recommend you panic".<ref>[http://www.businessinsider.com/hugh-hendry-vs-jeffrey-sachs-2010-5 "I Would Recommend You Stop Going Skiing And Panic"], [[Business Insider]], 27 May 2010. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref><ref name="Sachs">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nuysYXlJ43I "Greece, discussion on BBC Newsnight"], [[Newsnight]], 27 May 2010. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> An outspoken appearance on the BBC's [[Question Time (TV series)|Question Time]] followed in October 2010.<ref>Kaso, Hysni. [http://www.investmentweek.co.uk/investment-week/news/1856448/hendry-question-economy-mi6-bogeyman-bankers "Hendry on Question Time: The economy, MI6 and 'bogeyman' bankers"], [[Investment Week]], 29 October 2010. Retrieved 19 July 2012.</ref>
At the [[LSE Alternative Investment Conference|LSE Alternative Investments Conference]] in 2011, during a discussion with Steven Drobny, Hendry joked that his clients have banned him from further media appearances.<ref>[http://vimeo.com/29879763 "LSE AIC 2011 Invisible Hands Unveiled: A Keynote Dialogue Between the Plasticine Macro Trader and Author"], [[London School of Economics]] conference recording on [[Vimeo]], September 2011. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref> Hendry is the anonymous 'Plasticine Man' in Drobny's book on hedge fund managers 'Invisible Hands: Top Hedge Fund Traders on Bubbles, Crashes, and Real Money'.<ref>Polycapitalist, The. [http://www.businessinsider.com/mind-of-a-hedge-fund-manager-inside-hugh-hendrys-head-2011-1 "Hugh Hendry Explains His "Self Loathing" And The "Voices Inside His Head"], [[Business Insider]], 31 January 2011. Retrieved 8 June 2012.</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * [http://www.eclectica-am.com/template.aspx?target=people Hugh Hendry biography at Eclectica Asset Management]{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E4MAifsp-8E April 2010 BBC Newsnight discussion on Youtube] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nuysYXlJ43I 26 May 2010 BBC Newsnight discussion on Youtube] * [http://vimeo.com/29879763 London School of Economics Alternative Investment Conference 2011 Invisible Hands Unveiled: A Keynote Dialogue Between the Plasticine Macro Trader and Author. Conference recording on Vimeo.] * [http://valueslots.com/views-from-hugh-hendrys-2012-letter/ Views from Hugh Hendry’s 2012 Letter]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hendry, Hugh}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Strathclyde]] [[Category:People from Glasgow]] [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]] [[Category:Scottish hedge fund managers]] [[Category:People from Notting Hill]] [[Category:People from the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea]] [[Category:Businesspeople from London]] [[Category:21st-century Scottish businesspeople]]

{{Infobox officeholder |honorific-prefix = [[Colonel (United Kingdom)|Colonel]] [[The Right Honourable]] |name = The Lord Clydesmuir |honorific-suffix = {{postnominals|country=GBR|size=100%|GCIE|PC}} |image = John Colville 1931.jpg |caption = Colville in 1931 |office = [[List of Governors of Bombay|Governor of Bombay]] |primeminister = |term_start = 24 March 1943 |term_end = 5 January 1948 |predecessor = [[Roger Lumley, 11th Earl of Scarbrough|Roger Lumley]] |successor = [[Raja Maharaj Singh]] |office1 = [[Secretary of State for Scotland]] |primeminister1 = [[Neville Chamberlain]] |term_start1 = 6 May 1938 |term_end1 = 10 May 1940 |predecessor1 = [[Walter Elliot (Scottish politician)|Walter Elliot]] |successor1 = [[Ernest Brown (MP)|Ernest Brown]] |office2 = [[Financial Secretary to the Treasury]] |primeminister2 = [[Stanley Baldwin]]
[[Neville Chamberlain]] |term_start2 = 29 October 1936 |term_end2 = 6 May 1938 |predecessor2 = [[William Morrison, Viscount Dunrossil|William Morrison]] |successor2 = [[Euan Wallace]] |office3 = [[Under-Secretary of State for Scotland]] |primeminister3 = [[Stanley Baldwin]] |term_start3 = 28 November 1935 |term_end3 = 29 October 1936 |predecessor3 = [[Noel Skelton]] |successor3 = [[Henry Scrymgeour-Wedderburn, 11th Earl of Dundee|Henry Scrymgeour-Wedderburn]] |constituency_MP4 = [[Midlothian and Peebles Northern (UK Parliament constituency)|Midlothian and Peebles Northern]] |term_start4 = 30 May 1929 |term_end4 = January 1943 |predecessor4 = [[Andrew Clarke (Scottish politician)|Andrew Clarke]] |successor4 = [[David King Murray, Lord Birnam|Sir David King Murray]] }} [[Colonel]] '''David John Colville, 1st Baron Clydesmuir''', {{postnominals|country=GBR|size=100%|sep=,|GCIE|PC}} (13 February 1894 – 31 October 1954) was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[Unionist Party (Scotland)|Unionist]] politician, and industrialist. He was director of his family's steel and iron business: [[David Colville & Sons]].Family relative ==Early life and education== The only son of [[John Colville (1852–1901)|John Colville]] MP, of [[Cleland, North Lanarkshire|Cleland]], [[Lanarkshire]], he was educated at [[Charterhouse School|Charterhouse]] and at [[Trinity College, Cambridge]]. He served in [[World War I]] with the 6th Battalion of the [[Cameronians (Scottish Rifles)]], and was wounded. ==Political career== He was unsuccessful [[National Liberal Party (UK, 1922)|National Liberal]] candidate for [[Motherwell (UK Parliament constituency)|Motherwell]] at the [[United Kingdom general election, 1922|1922 General election]]. He was unsuccessful again at a [[Midlothian and Peebles Northern by-election, 1929|by-election in January 1929]] for [[Midlothian and Peebles Northern (UK Parliament constituency)|Midlothian and Peebles Northern]], but won the seat the [[United Kingdom general election, 1929|general election in May 1929]], remaining as the constituency's [[Member of Parliament]] (MP) until 1943. He served in the [[National Government (United Kingdom)|National Government]] as [[Parliamentary Secretary]] to the Department of Overseas Trade from 1931 to 1935, as [[Under-Secretary of State for Scotland]] from 1935 to 1936, as [[Financial Secretary to the Treasury]] from 1936 to 1938 and as [[Secretary of State for Scotland]] from 1938 until 1940. ==Diplomatic career and peerage== Colville left [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|Parliament]] in 1943 to become [[Governor of Bombay]], a post he held until January 1948. He acted as Viceroy and Governor-General of India, in 1945, 1946 and 1947. On his return from [[India]] he was raised to the peerage as Baron Clydesmuir, of Braidwood in the County of Lanarkshire. From 1950 to 1954 Lord Clydesmuir served as a Governor of the [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]]. Colville was appointed a [[Privy Council of the United Kingdom|Privy Counsellor]] in 1936 and was a Brigadier in the [[Royal Company of Archers]]. He was [[Lord Lieutenant of Lanarkshire]] from 1952 until his death. ==Marriage and children== He married Agnes Anne Bilsland, daughter of Sir William Bilsland, in 1915. They had a son and two daughters. His son, [[Ronald Colville, 2nd Baron Clydesmuir]], served as [[Governor of the Bank of Scotland]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} *Torrance, David, ''The Scottish Secretaries'' (Birlinn 2006) *Who Was Who ==External links== * {{Hansard-contribs | mr-john-colville-1 | John Colville }} {{S-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Midlothian and Peebles Northern (UK Parliament constituency)|Midlothian and Peebles Northern]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1929|1929]]–[[Midlothian and Peebles Northern by-election, 1943|1943]] | before = [[Andrew Bathgate Clarke]] | after = [[David King Murray, Lord Birnam|Sir David King Murray]] }} {{s-off}} {{succession box | title = [[Financial Secretary to the Treasury]] | years = 1936–1938 | before = [[William Morrison, 1st Viscount Dunrossil|William Morrison]] | after = [[Euan Wallace]] }} {{succession box|title=[[Secretary of State for Scotland]]|before=[[Walter Elliot (Scottish politician)|Walter Elliot]]|after=[[Ernest Brown (MP)|Ernest Brown]]|years=1938–1940}} {{succession box|title=[[Governor of Bombay]]|before=[[Lawrence Lumley, 11th Earl of Scarbrough|Sir Lawrence Lumley]]|after=[[Raja Maharaj Singh|Raja Sir Maharaj Singh]]|years=1943–1947}} {{s-hon}} {{succession box | before=[[Gavin Hamilton, 2nd Baron Hamilton of Dalzell|The Lord Hamilton of Dalzell]] | title=[[Lord Lieutenant of Lanarkshire]] | years=1952–1954 | after=[[Alexander Murray Stephen|Sir Alexander Murray Stephen]]}} {{s-reg|uk}} {{s-new | creation}} {{s-ttl | title=[[Baron Clydesmuir]] | years=1948–1954}} {{s-aft | after=[[Ronald Colville, 2nd Baron Clydesmuir|Ronald John Bilsland Colville]]}} {{S-end}} {{Secretaries of State for Scotland}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{resume like|date=December 2017}} {{EngvarB|date=December 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox officeholder |honorific-prefix = |name = Kofi Koduah Sarpong |honorific-suffix = |image = |imagesize = |smallimage = |alt = |caption = |order = |office = CEO of [[Ghana National Petroleum Corporation|GNPC]] |term_start = February 2017 |term_end = |president = [[Nana Akuffo-Addo]] |predecessor = Alex Mould |successor = ''Incumbent'' |birth_date = |birth_place = Ghana |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplaceco-ordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Ghanaian]] |party = [[New Patriotic Party]] |otherparty = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = Accra, Ghana |alma_mater = University of Ghana, [[University of Glasgow]] |occupation = Business person |profession = Administrator |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |signature_alt = |website = |footnotes = |blank1 = |data1 = |blank2 = |data2 = |blank3 = |data3 = |blank4 = |data4 = |blank5 = |data5 = }} '''Kofi Koduah Sarpong''' is a [[Ghanaian people|Ghanaian]] business executive and consultant. He is a member of the [[New Patriotic Party]] of Ghana. He served as Executive Chairman of Ghanaian football club, Kumasi Asante Kotoko from 2010 to 2013. He has worked for the International Cocoa Organization in London and Ghana Cocoa Board. He is the chief executive officer of [[Ghana National Petroleum Corporation|GNPC]] as of 2017.{{Cite news|url=http://www.ghheadlines.com/agency/ghana-web-/20170126/37794807/profile-of-dr-kofi-koduah-sarpong-new-ceo-of-gnpc|title=Profile of Dr Kofi Koduah Sarpong|access-date=27 November 2017|dead-url=}}{{Cite news|url=http://ugbs.ug.edu.gh/news/dr-k-k-sarpong-appointed-new-gnpc-boss|title=Dr K. K. Sarpong Appointed New GNPC Boss|last=Gadzekpo|first=Gilbert|date=2017-02-14|work=University of Ghana Business School|access-date=2017-12-19|language=en}} ==Early life and education== Kofi Sarpong was born at [[Nsuta-Beposo]] in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/Profile-of-Dr-Kofi-Koduah-Sarpong-new-ceo-of-GNPC-504318|title=Profile of Dr Kofi Koduah Sarpong, new ceo of GNPC|website=''ghanaweb.com''|access-date=27 November 2017}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/business/Profile-of-Dr-Kofi-Koduah-Sarpong-new-ceo-of-GNPC-504318|title=Profile of Dr Kofi Koduah Sarpong, new ceo of GNPC|website=''ghanaweb.com''|access-date=27 November 2017}} He obtained his [[GCE Ordinary Level]] certificate from the [[Seventh Day Adventist Secondary School]] in [[Bekwai]] and his [[GCE Advanced Level]] from [[Sekondi College]]. He gained admission to the [[University of Ghana]] to pursue a course in Business Administration.{{Cite web|url=https://biography.omicsonline.org/ghana/ghana-national-petroleum-corporation/kofi-koduah-sarpong-274755|title=Kofi Koduah Sarpong {{!}} Ghana National Petroleum Corporation {{!}} Ghana|website=OMICS International|access-date=27 November 2017}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=22020856&privcapId=12702121|title=Kofi Koduah Sarpong: Executive Profile & Biography|publisher=Bloomberg L.P.|access-date=27 November 2017}} He graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. He gained a World Bank scholarship in 1987 to study a Master of Business Administration from the University of Ghana. Upon completing his master's education, he was awarded a graduate scholarship to pursue a Master of Accountancy at the [[University of Glasgow]] in 1990.{{Cite web|url=http://global.getenergyevent.com/speaker/kofi-kodua-sarpong/|title=Kofi Kodua Sarpong " Getenergy Global|website=Getenergy Global|access-date=27 November 2017}} A [[Commonwealth Scholarship and Fellowship Plan|Commonwealth Scholarship]] offered him the opportunity to apply for a Doctor of Philosophy degree in Industrial and Business Studies from the [[University of Warwick]] in the United Kingdom.{{Cite web|url=http://www.reportingoilandgas.org/personalities/dr-kofi-koduah-sarpong/|title=Dr. Kofi Koduah Sarpong {{!}} Comprehensive Ghana Oil and Gas news, information, updates, analysis|website=www.reportingoilandgas.org|access-date=27 November 2017}} Kofi Sarpong also holds a Master of Arts in Ministry from the [[Trinity Theological Seminary, Ghana|Trinity Theological Seminary]], [[Legon]]. He is a [[Chartered accountant]] from the [[Association of Chartered Certified Accountants]], United Kingdom. == Working life == Sarpong was employed as an assistant accountant in 1979 at the now defunct Meat Marketing Board. In 1980, he was employed as Deputy Chief Accountant at Ghana Food Distribution Corporation. He rose through the ranks at the corporation to become Chief Accountant and subsequently general manager of the corporation. He resigned in 1990 to further his studies outside Ghana. Upon his return to Ghana in 1993, Sarpong was employed as Deputy Chief executive of [[Ghana Cocoa Board]]. He took up appointment at the [[International Cocoa Organization]], London in 1998 and served as the Head of Administration and Financial Services Division in 2001. In 2004, the then [[President of Ghana]], [[John Kufuor]], appointed Sarpong as the Deputy managing director of the [[Tema Oil Refinery]]. He was made the managing director of the refinery in 2007. When the [[John Evans Atta-Mills]] administration was voted into power in 2009, Sarpong was relieved of the position. From 2010 to 2013, Sarpong served as Executive Chairman of [[Kumasi Asante Kotoko]] Sporting Club. He was appointed by [[Otumfuo Nana Osei Tutu II]], King of the Asante Kingdom. The club won two [[Ghana Premier League]] titles, two Champion of Champions titles, and two FA Cup Runners-up positions.{{Cite news|url=https://www.graphic.com.gh/business/business-news/kk-sarpong-appointed-gnpc-boss.html|title=K.K. Sarpong takes over GNPC job from Alex Mould – Graphic Online|last=graphic.com.gh|work=Graphic Online|access-date=27 November 2017}} Strategic co-operations with foreign clubs were also established with [[Sunderland A.F.C.]] in the United Kingdom, [[TP Mazembe]] in [[DR Congo]] and Petro Luanda in Angola. After Asante Kotoko, Sarpong took up the position of Chief executive of The Global Haulage Group, a Ghanaian cocoa buying and exporting company. He was also the chairman of the boards of [[The Royal Bank, Ghana]] and Imperial General Assurance Ltd. He resigned from boards in 2016. == CEO of GNPC == In February 2017, [[Nana Akufo-Addo|President Nana Akufo-Addo]], appointed Sarpong as Acting chief executive officer of Ghana National Petroleum Corporation. He replaced [[Alex Mould]] who had served as CEO since 2013.{{Cite news|url=http://citifmonline.com/2017/09/27/alex-mould-backs-calls-for-review-of-fuel-taxes/|title=Alex Mould backs calls for review of fuel taxes – Ghana News|date=27 September 2017|work=Ghana News|access-date=27 November 2017}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.ghananewsagency.org/economics/alex-mould-heads-gnpc-65660|title=Alex Mould heads GNPC|access-date=27 November 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Alex Mould]]}} {{s-ttl|title=CEO GNPC
Ghana|years=2017 – }} {{s-inc}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sarpong, Kofi Koduah}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Ghana alumni]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Warwick]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Glasgow]] [[Category:Ghanaian accountants]] [[Category:People from Ashanti Region]] [[Category:Ghanaian businesspeople]] [[Category:Sekondi College alumni]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Chinese name|[[Guo|Kwek]]}} '''Kwek Hong Png''' ({{zh|s=郭芳枫|zh|t=郭芳楓|p=Guō Fāng Fēng}}; 1912 - 8 November 1994) was a Singaporean businessperson, known for establishing [[Hong Leong Group]], of which he was also chairperson. Born to a penniless family, Kwek turned from rags to riches after arriving in Singapore in 1928, eventually becoming one of the world's richest men, with an estimated net worth of [[Singapore dollar|S$]]3 billion before his retirement in 1984.
==Early life== Born 1913 in [[Fujian]]'s [[Tung Ann]] district<ref name="Hong Leong 1">{{cite web |url=http://www.hongleong.com.sg/taxonomy/term/4 |title=History |publisher=Hong Leong Group |accessdate=11 May 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130810125729/http://www.hongleong.com.sg/taxonomy/term/4 |archivedate=10 August 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news.gov.sg/public/sgpc/en/media_releases/agencies/acm/press_release/P-20090407-1/AttachmentPar/0/file/Press%20Release%20-%20Hong%20Leong%20Donation%20For%20ACM%20China%20Gallery.pdf |title=Asian Civilisations Museum Receives S$5 million Gift For Expansion of Its China Gallery |publisher=news.gov.sg |accessdate=11 May 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110812224937/http://www.news.gov.sg/public/sgpc/en/media_releases/agencies/acm/press_release/P-20090407-1/AttachmentPar/0/file/Press%20Release%20-%20Hong%20Leong%20Donation%20For%20ACM%20China%20Gallery.pdf |archivedate=12 August 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> to a miserly farmer,<ref>{{cite book|title=Historical Dictionary of Singapore |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vhBMmG9yXgYC&pg=PA346 |page=346 |last=Corfield |first=Justin |isbn=9780810873872 |year=2010 |publisher=Scarecrow Press }}</ref> Kwek arrived in Singapore in 1928 from Fujian.<ref name="Routledge 1">{{cite book|title=Chinese Entrepreneurship and Asian Business Networks |page=200 |year=2012 |publisher=Routledge |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=2bO2UMZx4FAC&pg=PA200 |isbn=9781136002304 |last1=Menkhoff |first1=Thomas |last2=Solvay |first2=Gerke }}</ref> He first started out as a shop helper<ref>{{cite book|volume=20 |title=Asiaweek |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RxgNAQAAMAAJ |year=1994 |publisher=Asiaweek Limited |page=16 }}</ref> at his brother-in-law's hardware firm.<ref>{{cite book|first=Gary G. |last=Hamilton |title=Business Networks and Economic Development in East and Southeast Asia |year=1991 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FHu7AAAAIAAJ |publisher=Centre of Asian Studies, University of Hong Kong }}</ref> His monthly salary then was just $5<ref name="Hong Leong 1"/> and he reportedly slept on the floors of the store.<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=Forbes |url=https://www.forbes.com/global/2001/0709/046_2.html |title=The man with the golden machine gun |first1=Justin |last1=Doebele |first2=Heidi |last2=Brown |date=9 July 2001 }}</ref> During [[World War II]], Kwek became rich by trading construction materials.<ref>{{cite book|title=The Dragon Network: Inside Stories of the Most Successful Chinese Family Businesses |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xq18xB7SpPgC&pg=PA10 |publisher=John Wiley & Sons |year=2010 |page=10 |first1=A.B. |first2=Patricia |last2=Susanto |last1=Susanto }}</ref> He also participated in smuggling basic goods<ref>{{cite book|last=Studwell |first=Joe |title=Asian Godfathers |page=21 |year=2008 |publisher=Grove Press |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=720iFSxkII8C&pg=PA21&lpg=PA21 |isbn=9781555848927 }}</ref> and traded with Japanese merchants.<ref>{{cite book|title=Asian Godfathers: Money and Power in Hong Kong and South East Asia |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NwtqxB0GYLwC&pg=PA271 |last=Studwell |first=Joe |page=271 |publisher=Profile Books |year=2010 |isbn=9781847651440 }}</ref>
==Career== Founded in 1941,<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FalApWB2yAYC&pg=PA36 |page=36 |title=Dragon Multinational: A New Model for Global Growth: A New Model for Global Growth |year=2002 |first=John A. |last=Matthews |publisher=Oxford University Press |isbn=9780195352894 }}</ref> the Hong Leong Group was originally a trading company that supplied basic construction materials<ref>{{cite book|title=The City in Southeast Asia: Patterns, Processes, and Policy |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=-oIyKT1MOA4C&pg=PA209 |page=209 |year=2009 |first1=Peter James |last1=Rimmer |first2=Howard W. |last2=Dick |isbn=9789971694265 |publisher=NUS Press }}</ref> and rubber.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hlasia.com.sg/who_milestone.aspx |title=History |publisher=Hong Leong Asia |accessdate=11 May 2013 }}</ref> Wanting to work as a team, Kwek subsequently beckoned his three brothers to join Hong Leong.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=283sAAAAMAAJ |title=The overseas Chinese entrepreneurs in East Asia: background, business practices and international networks |last=Ch'ng |first=David C.L. |year=1993 |publisher=Committee for the Economic Development of Australia |page=87 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=Leading Successfully in Asia |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_-QQSQSJH2YC&pg=PA97 |page=97 |first=Patrick |last=Kim |isbn=9783642312878 |publisher=Springer |year=2013 }}</ref> Becoming chairman of the organisation in 1956,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sgebooks.nl.sg/image.aspx?id=0c15947f-047a-4c8e-854e-138bd8457b52 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130616142506/http://sgebooks.nl.sg/image.aspx?id=0c15947f-047a-4c8e-854e-138bd8457b52 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=16 June 2013 |title=Portrait of Mr. Kwek Hong Png, founder of Hong Leong Company |publisher=BooksSG |accessdate=11 May 2013 }}</ref> Kwek retired in 1984;<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jueyAAAAIAAJ |page=331 |year=1995 |author=East Asia Analytical Unit |publisher=Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade |isbn=9780642229601 |title=Overseas Chinese business networks in Asia }}</ref> before that, his net worth was estimated by Forbes to be worth [[Singapore dollar|S$]]3 billion.<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=Asian Finance |volume=10 |number=7–12 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_sYSAQAAMAAJ |page=176 |publisher=Asian Finance Publications |year=1984 |title=A new management at Hong Leong }}</ref> He was also ranked one of the wealthiest men in the world by Forbes.<ref name="LA Times 1"/>
==Lawsuit== [[File:Kwek Hong Png Wing, Asian Civilisations Museum, Singapore - 20151114-02.jpg|thumb|upright|The Kwek Hong Png Wing of the [[Asian Civilisations Museum]] opened in 2015]]
In November 1989, a lawsuit was filed against Kwek for the misuse of funds as well as abetment.<ref name="LA Times 1">{{cite news|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1989-11-29/business/fi-289_1_funds-charge|title=P.M. BRIEFING : Billionaire Faces Funds Charge|date=29 November 1989}}</ref> Represented by G. P. Selvam, Kwek was later found guilty of the charges, with a pending charge of "dishonestly receiving stolen property". Kwek was later allowed bail set at a million dollars.<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=The Straits Times|url=http://newspapers.nl.sg/Digitised/Article/straitstimes19891019.2.7.6.aspx|title=Kwek Hong Png charged with abetting in CBT|page=3|date=19 October 1989 }}</ref> Kwek's passport was also seized as a precaution.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hong Leong founder's case put off for another two weeks|newspaper=[[The Straits Times]]|date=16 November 1989|page=19}}</ref>
==Death and legacy== Kwek died in 1994, aged 82.<ref>{{cite news|title=Untitled section, (Obituaries & illustrations) 16 pp.|newspaper=The Straits Times|date=10 November 1994|page=1}}</ref> Louis Kraar of CNN described Kwek as "Singapore's leading developer".<ref>{{cite news|newspaper=CNN|url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1995/12/25/208781/|last=Kraar|first=Louis|title=The Mystery Man Who Took The Plaza From Donald Trump|date=25 December 1995|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203071247/http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1995/12/25/208781/|archivedate=3 December 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His empire was later inherited by his son, [[Kwek Leng Beng]].<ref name="Routledge 1"/> In 2003 a gallery displaying Chinese artefacts at the [[Asian Civilisations Museum]] was named after Kwek,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hongleong.com.sg/docs/news/2003/2003_01-03-20_10168.htm|title=Asian Civilisations Museum names gallery after Hong Leong Group founder|date=1 March 2003|newspaper=Hong Leong|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203050640/http://www.hongleong.com.sg/docs/news/2003/2003_01-03-20_10168.htm|archivedate=3 December 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and in 2015, following renovations to the museum, a new wing called the Kwek Hong Png Wing was opened.
==References== {{Reflist|20em}}
[[Category:1913 births]] [[Category:1994 deaths]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Fujian]] [[Category:Chinese emigrants to Singapore]] [[Category:People from Xiamen]] [[Category:Singaporean billionaires]] [[Category:Singaporean businesspeople]] [[Category:Singaporean people of Hokkien descent]]

{{Infobox video game | collapsible = | state = | title = Last Call! | image = | alt = | caption = | developer = Cutler Creative | publisher = Simon & Schuster Interactive | series = | engine = | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS]] | released = {{Video game release|NA|2000}} | genre = | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Last Call!''''' is a video game for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] released in 2000 by publisher [[Simon & Schuster]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|title = Last Call Review|url = http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/last-call|website = www.gamerevolution.com|accessdate = 2015-07-29|last = Silverman|first = Ben|date = 2000-03-01}}</ref> Those playing the game take on the role of a bartender attempting to maximize tips from customers.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title=Last Call! - Overview - allgame |url=http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=23852 |date=2014-12-11 |accessdate=2015-07-29 |last=Hernandez |first=Tara |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141211112443/http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=23852 |archivedate=December 11, 2014 }}</ref>
== Development == The game was developed by Cutler Creative and supported [[Windows 95]] and [[Windows 98]]. The game's creator, John Cutler, first got the idea for the game in 1995. He wanted to have a game that could teach people to mix drinks. Under the original title Bartender USA, the player would start at a [[Howard Johnson's]] and gradually work their way up to a trendy bar in New York City. At the time, Cutler had no video game experience, and didn't own a computer until he started development. He attended [[E3]] and also worked as a bartender to better understand what he needed to do. He hired programmers and artists to put together a mockup of the game. The original concept included some live action animation, which was dropped from the final game. Simon & Schuster had recently published the comedy game [[Deer Avenger]], and agreed to publish the game since it matched up with their business model at the time. This agreement gave Cutler's team funding to develop and complete the game. Due to Cutler's inexperience, many aspects of the game needed to be rethought during the development process. Cutler credited his choice to use [[Macromedia Director]] as making a mammoth task much easier. He struggled with [[feature creep]] and his relationship with the testing company.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|title = Postmortem: Cutler Creative's Last Call|url = http://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/131490/postmortem_cutler_creatives_last_.php|website = www.gamasutra.com|accessdate = 2015-07-29|last = Cutler|first = John|date = 2001-05-11}}</ref>
== Gameplay == The setting of the game is a fictional bar in New York City. The player, as bartender, must learn to mix over one hundred drinks. They also have to ID all customers (serving an underage customer will get the player fired), charm customers, keep music playing, and keep customers from being too drunk. The game offers a recipe book for players, but players will score better if they don't use it. Also, without memorizing the recipes, the player will run out of time.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|title = Last Call|url = http://www.ign.com/articles/2000/04/05/last-call|website = IGN|date = 2000-04-04|accessdate = 2015-07-29|first = I. G. N.|last = Staff}}</ref> The ultimate goal of the game is to get the most tips. There are around 20 characters that the player needs to serve in the game. One of these characters is Vincent the Hedgehog, who is an actual hedgehog.<ref name=":1" />
== Reviews and sales == Review of the game were mixed. Ben Silverman of Game Revolution describes it as a casual game, and not one that a player would expect to play for hours. Silverman described it as a replacement for Solitaire that wouldn't hook players, but also stated that with its low price, it may be worth buying.<ref name=":0" /> Lisa Savignano of All Game praised the creative characters, but noted that some of the graphics were poor.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Last Call! - Review - allgame |url=http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=23852&tab=review |date=2014-11-17 |accessdate=2015-07-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141117050219/http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=23852&tab=review |archivedate=November 17, 2014 }}</ref> IGN appreciated the large library of drinks, but noted that the animation was often clunky.<ref name=":2" />
The game sold poorly and was a flop. Despite this, for the French and UK market under the name Happy Hour, and in Germany under the name On the Rocks. Cutler was surprised at the nearly even ratio of male to female purchasers.<ref name=":3" />
The video game is rated mature and is not recommended for those younger than 21.<ref name=":1" />
